title: Multi-Site Analysis for Independent Data Sources
text: process exploratory analysis cross-sectional longitudinal configurations. First, execute either Single Site, Exploratory analyses, configured appropriately study, data source. , combine results single table different sites delineated site column.
code: library(patientrecordconsistency)  my_table <- prc_process(cohort = my_cohort,                         multi_or_single_site = 'single',                         anomaly_or_exploratory = 'exploratory',                         time = T / F,                         ...) my_final_results <- my_table1 %>% dplyr::union(my_table2) ... %>%   dplyr::union(my_table_n) %>%   dplyr::mutate(output_function = '{see table above}')

title: Multi-Site Analysis for Independent Data Sources
text: First, execute Single Site, Anomaly Detection, Cross-Sectional analysis, configured appropriately study, data source. , combine results single table different sites delineated site column. Finally, use combined table input compute_dist_anomalies detect_outliers functions, available squba.gen package. p_value can selected user.
code: library(patientrecordconsistency)  my_table <- prc_process(cohort = my_cohort,                         multi_or_single_site = 'single',                         anomaly_or_exploratory = 'anomaly',                         time = F,                         ...) my_final_results <- my_table1 %>% dplyr::union(my_table2) ... %>%   dplyr::union(my_table_n) # First, execute the compute_dist_anomalies function df_start <- compute_dist_anomalies(df_tbl = my_table,                                    grp_vars = c('fu_bin'),                                    var_col = 'jaccard_index',                                    denom_cols = c('fu_bin'))  # Finally, use that output as input for the detect_outliers function df_final <- detect_outliers(df_tbl = df_start,                             tail_input = 'both',                             p_input = p_value,                             column_analysis = 'jaccard_index',                             column_variable = 'fu_bin') %>%   dplyr::mutate(output_function = '{see table above}')

title: Multi-Site Analysis for Independent Data Sources
text: Start executing steps exploratory analysis. , apply additional formatting () final combined table pass ms_anom_euclidean function, available squba.gen package.
code: ## Additional formatting for the table event_categorization <- prc_tbl %>%   uncount(pt_ct) %>%   mutate(stat_type = case_when(event_a_num == 0 & event_b_num == 0 ~ 'Neither Event',                                event_a_num == 0 & event_b_num != 0 ~ 'Event B Only',                                event_a_num != 0 & event_b_num == 0 ~ 'Event A Only',                                event_a_num != 0 & event_b_num != 0 ~ 'Both Events')) %>%   group_by(site, time_start, time_increment,             event_a_name, event_b_name, total_pts, stat_type) %>%   summarise(stat_ct = n(),             prop_event = stat_ct / total_pts) %>% ungroup()  ## Apply Euclidean distance computation df <- ms_anom_euclidean(fot_input_tbl = event_categorization,                         grp_vars = c('site', 'stat_type'),                         var_col = 'prop_event')

what: Evaluate the Consistency of Event Occurrence in Patient Records
title: Evaluate the Consistency of Event Occurrence in Patient Records
text: Patient Record Consistency module assesses presence two user-defined events within patient record cohort. allows investigators assess consistency event occurrences cohort.

title: Evaluate the Consistency of Event Occurrence in Patient Records
text: can install development version package like :
code: devtools::install_github('ssdqa/patientrecordconsistency')

title: Compute the counts of each event within the patient record and across the cohort — compute_event_counts_omop
text: cohort table cohort members least site_col, person_id, start_date, end_date grouped_list list columns used group table site_col name column site names time logical determine whether output check across time event_tbl table definitions event columns event - B event_label - descriptive label event domain_tbl - default CDM table data retrieved concept_field - field table codes interest stored date_field - date field used establish index & occurrence dates vocabulary_field - (PCORnet ) name column domain table vocabulary type stored codeset_name - name codeset specs directory define variable interest filter_logic - string indicating filter logic applied establish event ex: Hba1c > 6.5

title: PRC Sample Event File — prc_event_file
text: data frame 7 columns event B; represents two events occur first second sequence event_label arbitrary string label event domain_tbl name CDM table associated domain concepts associated event can found concept_field name column domain table contains concepts interest date_field name column domain table contains dates used establishing sequence events. vocabulary_field (PCORnet ) name column domain table vocabulary type stored codeset_name name codeset (found file_subdirectory) used define event filter_logic (optional) string parsed logic filter domain_tbl needed best represent event

code: if there were no groups eligible for analysis, a heat map showing the jaccard index     and a dot plot showing each site's average standard deviation away from the mean     index is returned instead

what: Patient Record Consistency – Output Generation — prc_output
title: Patient Record Consistency – Output Generation — prc_output
text: Using tabular output generated prc_process, function build graph visualize results. function configuration output bespoke ggplot. Theming can adjusted user graph output using + theme(). graphs can also made interactive using make_interactive_squba()

title: Patient Record Consistency – Output Generation — prc_output
code: prc_output(   process_output,   dist_from_stat = "mean",   event_filter = NULL,   large_n = FALSE,   large_n_sites = NULL )

title: Patient Record Consistency – Output Generation — prc_output
text: process_output tabular input || required tabular output produced pes_process Note patient-level results generated intended used function. dist_from_stat string || defaults mean string indicating statistic distance measured Multi-Site, Exploratory, Longitudinal check Acceptable values mean median event_filter string || defaults NULL string indicating event co-occurrence type interest analysis. parameter required following checks: Single Site, Anomaly Detection, Longitudinal Multi-Site, Anomaly Detection, Longitudinal Acceptable values , b, , neither large_n boolean || defaults FALSE Multi-Site analyses, boolean indicating whether large N visualization, intended high volume sites, used. visualization produce high level summaries across sites, option add specific site comparators via large_n_sites parameter. large_n_sites vector || defaults NULL large_n = TRUE, vector site names can add site-level information plot comparison across high level summary information

title: Patient Record Consistency – Output Generation — prc_output
text: function produce graph visualize results prc_process based parameters provided. default output typically static ggplot gt object, interactive elements can activated passing plot make_interactive_squba. detailed description output specific check type, see PEDSpace metadata repository

title: Patient Record Consistency – Output Generation — prc_output
Patient Record Consistency — prc_process
text: concordance module assess consistency within patient record evaluating presence absence two user-provided clinical events (prc_event_file). checks module establish whether one , neither, events present patient record summarize results across full cohort. sample version input file accessible patientrecordconsistency::. function compatible OMOP PCORnet CDMs based user's selection.

title: Patient Record Consistency — prc_process
code: prc_process(   cohort,   prc_event_file,   omop_or_pcornet,   multi_or_single_site = "single",   anomaly_or_exploratory = "exploratory",   age_groups = NULL,   patient_level_tbl = FALSE,   fu_breaks = c(0, 1, 3, 8, 11, 15, 25, 50, 100),   p_value = 0.9,   time = FALSE,   time_span = c("2012-01-01", "2020-01-01"),   time_period = "year" )

title: Patient Record Consistency — prc_process
text: cohort tabular input || required cohort used data quality testing. table contain, minimum: site | character | name(s) institutions included cohort person_id / patid | integer / character | patient identifier start_date | date | start cohort period end_date | date | end cohort period Note start end dates included table used limit search window analyses module. prc_event_file tabular input || required table definitions events. table contain two rows, one event, following columns: event | character | string, either B, representing event type. treated event expected occur first sequence event_label | character | descriptive label event domain_tbl | character | name CDM table event defined concept_field | character | string name field domain table concepts located date_field | character | name field domain table date used temporal filtering vocabulary_field | character | PCORnet applications, name field domain table vocabulary identifier differentiate concepts one another (ex: dx_type); can set NA OMOP applications codeset_name | character | name codeset defines event interest filter_logic | character | logic applied domain_tbl order achieve definition interest; written applying dplyr::filter command R see example input, see ?patientrecordconsistency::prc_event_file omop_or_pcornet string || required string, either omop pcornet, indicating CDM format data omop: run prc_process_omop() function OMOP CDM instance pcornet: run prc_process_pcornet() function PCORnet CDM instance multi_or_single_site string || defaults single string, either single multi, indicating whether single-site multi-site analysis executed anomaly_or_exploratory string || defaults exploratory string, either anomaly exploratory, indicating type results produced. Exploratory analyses give high level summary data examine fact representation within cohort. Anomaly detection analyses specialized identify outliers within cohort. age_groups tabular input || defaults NULL like stratify results age group, create table CSV file following columns use input parameter: min_age | integer | minimum age group (.e. 10) max_age | integer | maximum age group (.e. 20) group | character | string label group (.e. 10-20, Young Adult, etc.) like stratify age group, leave NULL patient_level_tbl boolean || defaults FALSE boolean indicating whether additional table patient level results output. TRUE, output function list containing summary patient level output. Otherwise, function just output summary dataframe fu_breaks vector || defaults c(0, 1, 3, 8, 11, 15, 25, 50, 100) numeric vector defines group different windows follow time. parameter used Anomaly Detection, Cross-Sectional checks p_value numeric || defaults 0.9 p value used threshold Multi-Site, Anomaly Detection, Cross-Sectional analysis time boolean || defaults FALSE boolean indicate whether execute longitudinal analysis time_span vector - length 2 || defaults c('2012-01-01', '2020-01-01') vector indicating lower upper bounds time series longitudinal analyses time_period string || defaults year string indicating distance dates within specified time_span. Defaults year, time periods month week also acceptable

title: Patient Record Consistency — prc_process
text: function return dataframe summarizing co-occurrence events within patient record. detailed description output specific check type, see PEDSpace metadata repository

title: Patient Record Consistency — prc_process
Patient Record Consistency – OMOP — prc_process_omop
text: Patient Record Consistency – OMOP

title: Patient Record Consistency – OMOP — prc_process_omop
code: prc_process_omop(   cohort,   prc_event_file,   multi_or_single_site = "single",   anomaly_or_exploratory = "exploratory",   age_groups = NULL,   patient_level_tbl = FALSE,   fu_breaks = c(0, 1, 3, 8, 11, 15, 25, 50, 100),   p_value = 0.9,   time = FALSE,   time_span = c("2012-01-01", "2020-01-01"),   time_period = "year" )

title: Patient Record Consistency – OMOP — prc_process_omop
text: cohort cohort SQUBA testing; required fields: site person_id start_date end_date prc_event_file table definitions event columns event - B event_label - descriptive label event domain_tbl - default CDM table data retrieved concept_field - field table codes interest stored date_field - date field used establish index & occurrence dates vocabulary_field - (PCORnet ) name column domain table vocabulary type stored codeset_name - name codeset specs directory define variable interest filter_logic - string indicating filter logic applied establish event ex: Hba1c > 6.5 multi_or_single_site Option run function single vs multiple sites single - run function single site multi - run function multiple sites anomaly_or_exploratory Option conduct exploratory anomaly detection analysis. Exploratory analyses give high level summary data examine fact representation within cohort. Anomaly detection analyses specialized identify outliers within cohort. age_groups like stratify results age group,  create table CSV file following columns include age_groups function parameter: min_age: minimum age group (.e. 10) max_age: maximum age group (.e. 20) group: string label group (.e. 10-20, Young Adult, etc.) like stratify age group, leave argument NULL patient_level_tbl logical controlling whether patient level output returned fu_breaks numeric vector defines group different windows follow time p_value p value used threshold multi-site anomaly detection analysis time logical tells function whether like look output time time_span time = TRUE, argument defines start end dates time period interest. formatted c(start date, end date) yyyy-mm-dd date format time_period time = TRUE, argument defines distance dates within specified time period. defaults year, time periods month week also acceptable

title: Patient Record Consistency – OMOP — prc_process_omop
text: dataframe summarizing often two events occur co-occur within patient record

title: Patient Record Consistency – PCORnet — prc_process_pcornet

title: Patient Record Consistency – PCORnet — prc_process_pcornet
text: cohort cohort SQUBA testing; required fields: site person_id start_date end_date prc_event_file table definitions event columns event - B event_label - descriptive label event domain_tbl - default CDM table data retrieved concept_field - field table codes interest stored date_field - date field used establish index & occurrence dates vocabulary_field - (PCORnet ) name column domain table vocabulary type stored codeset_name - name codeset specs directory define variable interest filter_logic - string indicating filter logic applied establish event ex: Hba1c > 6.5 multi_or_single_site Option run function single vs multiple sites single - run function single site multi - run function multiple sites anomaly_or_exploratory Option conduct exploratory anomaly detection analysis. Exploratory analyses give high level summary data examine fact representation within cohort. Anomaly detection analyses specialized identify outliers within cohort. age_groups like stratify results age group,  create table CSV file following columns include age_groups function parameter: min_age: minimum age group (.e. 10) max_age: maximum age group (.e. 20) group: string label group (.e. 10-20, Young Adult, etc.) like stratify age group, leave argument NULL patient_level_tbl logical controlling whether patient level output returned fu_breaks numeric vector defines group different windows follow time p_value p value used threshold multi-site anomaly detection analysis time logical tells function whether like look output time time_span time = TRUE, argument defines start end dates time period interest. formatted c(start date, end date) yyyy-mm-dd date format time_period time = TRUE, argument defines distance dates within specified time period. defaults year, time periods month week also acceptable

title: patientrecordconsistency (development version)
text: Initial CRAN submission.
